meanings.definition: (ラテン語) 祈る、懇願する

etymology.value: 印欧祖語の根 *prek-（尋ねる、懇願する）に由来する。

verb_forms.present_active: precor, precaris, precatur, precamur, precamini, precantur
verb_forms.imperfect_active: precarer, precareris, precaretur, precaremur, precaremini, precarentur
verb_forms.future_active: precar, precaris, precabitur, precabimur, precabimini, precabuntur
verb_forms.perfect_active: precatus sum, precatus es, precatus est, precati sumus, precati estis, precati sunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_active: precatus eram, precatus eras, precatus erat, precati eramus, precati eratis, precati erant
verb_forms.future_perfect_active: precatus ero, precatus eris, precatus erit, precati erimus, precati eritis, precati erunt
verb_forms.present_passive: precor, precaris, precatur, precamur, precamini, precantur
verb_forms.imperfect_passive: precarer, precareris, precaretur, precaremur, precaremini, precarentur
verb_forms.future_passive: precar, precaris, precabitur, precabimur, precabimini, precabuntur
verb_forms.perfect_passive: precatus sum, precatus es, precatus est, precati sumus, precati estis, precati sunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_passive: precatus eram, precatus eras, precatus erat, precati eramus, precati eratis, precati erant
verb_forms.future_perfect_passive: precatus ero, precatus eris, precatus erit, precati erimus, precati eritis, precati erunt

usage_notes.explanation: ラテン語の動詞で、神や人に対して何かを強く求める意味を持つ。派生語として英語の precarious (不安定な、危うい) がある。

derivatives: precarius (形容詞: 不安定な、一時的な)
